intro: Blaeria leucocephala, commonly known as the white-headed blazer, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
